newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-BLACK S.AFRICAN VIES FOR LUYT JOB.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-BLACK S.AFRICAN VIES FOR LUYT JOB.

text.p: A Coloured (mixed-race) rugby official said on Wednesday he would challenge Louis Luyt for the job of Transvaal Rugby Union president, the first person to do so since 1988.
"Luyt runs Transvaal rugby like it is his private reserve," Brian van Rooyen, currently Luyt's vice-president, said in a statement.
"There is no transparency and the members of the TRU executive are treated like rubber stamps for what he decides in advance. I am nobody's puppet," van Rooyen said.
He said he was confident of winning the vote at a TRU meeting on Monday.
"There is a clear majority who want change... It's clearly not only in our province where Dr Luyt's influence is not wanted anymore."
Luyt, who is also president of the South African Rugby Football Union, is frequently accused of running the sport with an autocratic hand.
